intro: Dizygotheca tenuifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its slender, zigzagging stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces pods that contain small, round seeds. Dizygotheca tenuifolia is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in various soil conditions.
